{@b Other Effects:} The plant's soothing properties can enhance the consumer's ability to diagnose and treat ailments. Additionally, when encountering unknown diseases, the flowers of Lunae Radiata can help the consumer make more accurate assessments and develop effective treatments.

item.name: Aqua Aura
entries: {@b Common Name:} Water Spirit

{@b Description:} Aqua Aura is a medium-sized plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has broad, waxy leaves that are a vibrant blue-green, resembling water droplets. The plant produces small, delicate blue flowers that cluster around the base, emitting a fresh, aquatic fragrance.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Aqua Aura thrives in moist, well-drained soils near freshwater sources like rivers and lakes. It prefers partial to full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring near a water source. Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Aqua Aura in late spring when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves in a cool, dark place to preserve their properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried. For medicinal purposes, create tinctures or infusions with the dried leaves and flowers.

{@b Magical Properties:} Aqua Aura can be utilized in effects that produce water. If other, more powerful ingredients are used, Aqua Aura can even contribute to manipulating weather patterns. Additionally, This mystical plant can be harnessed to restore vigor. It is commonly used in a tincture known as "Essence of the Water Spirit." When properly prepared, this tincture becomes a remedy for characters suffering from severe dehydration. Administering the tincture replenishes lost fluids and restores vitality.

{@b Other Effects:} Due to the potent compounds within its leaves and flowers, Aqua Aura is not suitable for raw consumption. If ingested, the plant causes severe body swelling and immobilization, which can be utilized in certain concoctions.

item.name: Glacialis Frigora
entries: {@b Common Name:} Frost Lotus

{@b Description:} Glacialis Frigora is a low-growing, perennial herb that reaches up to 0.3 meters in height. It has broad, frosty-blue leaves covered in a fine layer of ice crystals, even in warmer weather. The plant produces large, snow-white berries with a subtle, silvery sheen. The berries emit a cool, refreshing scent, reminiscent of freshly fallen snow.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Glacialis Frigora thrives in cold, mountainous regions and tundras. It prefers well-drained, rocky soils and requires full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn before the ground freezes. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to survive in low moisture environments.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Glacialis Frigora in early winter when they are most potent. Dry the leaves quickly to retain their icy properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried. For medicinal purposes, create infusions or ointments with the dried flowers.

{@b Magical Properties:} The leaves of Glacialis Frigora provides a boost to Survival. The plant's icy properties enhance the consumer's ability to endure harsh, cold environments and navigate through blizzards.
{@b Other Effects:} Rituals involving the flowers of Glacialis Frigora are believed to be able to summon frost spirits for guidance and protection.

item.name: Virosa Ignitus
entries: {@b Common Name:} Firethorn

{@b Description:} Virosa Ignitus is a hardy, thorny shrub that grows up to 1 meter in height. It has thick, leathery leaves that are dark green with a reddish tinge. The plant produces clusters of small, bright red berries that look inviting but are highly toxic. The shrub is covered in sharp thorns that glow faintly red in the dark, giving it a menacing appearance.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Virosa Ignitus thrives in dry, rocky terrains and is often found in mountainous regions. It prefers well-drained, sandy soils and full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring and ensure they receive plenty of sunlight. Water sparingly, as the plant is highly drought-resistant.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and berries of Virosa Ignitus in late summer with great caution. The leaves can be dried and used in various preparations. The berries, despite their toxicity, can be processed into powerful medicines under the guidance of a skilled herbalist. Use gloves and avoid direct contact with the plant to prevent poisoning.

{@b Magical Properties:} Virosa Ignitus is highly valued for its protective and cursing properties. Placing the thorns around a sacred area is believed to ward off intruders and malevolent spirits. The berries, when used in dark rituals, can cast powerful curses or break strong enchantments. Carrying a thorn of Virosa Ignitus is thought to provide protection from harm but must be handled with care.

{@b Other Effects:} Virosa Ignitus is not edible due to its highly toxic nature. Consuming any part of the plant can lead to severe poisoning and even death. Small, carefully prepared doses of the berries can be used in alchemical brews to boost Constitution, but this is a risky practice.

item.name: Nocturna Florealis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Moonlight Blossom

{@b Description:} Nocturna Florealis is a small plant that grows up to 0.3 meters tall. It has broad, silvery leaves that shimmer faintly in the moonlight. The flowers are pale white, with a slight iridescence, arranged in small clusters at the tips of the stems. Each bloom emits a soft, phosphorescent glow, which becomes more pronounced during the night, especially under a full moon.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Nocturna Florealis thrives in cool, shaded woodland areas with rich, loamy soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. This perennial plant should be planted in early spring or late autumn for optimal growth. Regular watering is essential, especially during dry periods, to maintain the plant's luminescent properties.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Nocturna Florealis at dusk during the full moon. Dry the leaves slowly to preserve their delicate structure and luminescence. The flowers can be used for medicinal purposes, create tinctures using the fresh flowers.
{@b Magical Properties:} The silvery leaves of Nocturna Florealis can grant visions of the future, while its flowers can provide clarity and insight to the consumer.

{@b Other Effects:} Nocturna Florealis contains trace amounts of a neurotoxin in its roots, which can cause mild dizziness and nausea if ingested. Additionally, the consumption of the plant can lead to insomnia. It is crucial to avoid consuming the roots or any preparations derived from them.

item.name: Nox Umbra
entries: {@b Common Name:} Shadow Fern

{@b Description:} Nox Umbra is a small, delicate fern that grows up to 0.4 meters in height. It has thin, feathery fronds that are a deep, inky black with a slight iridescent sheen. The plant produces small, dark purple spores that shimmer faintly in the dark. The entire plant has a faint, musty scent that is most noticeable in the evening.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Nox Umbra thrives in dark, damp forests and caves with rich, loamy soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and very low light. To cultivate, plant the spores in early spring in a shaded, moist area. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the fronds of Nox Umbra in late autumn when they are most vibrant. Dry the fronds in a dark, cool place to preserve their color and potency. The spores can be used fresh or dried. For medicinal purposes, create tinctures or infusions with the dried fronds.

{@b Magical Properties:} Nox Umbra is most commonly utilized for effects relating to stealth. Less powerful concoctions provide minor concealment for the user, while using with more potent ingredients can contribute to effects akin to etherealness.

{@b Other Effects:} The roots of Nox Umbra roots enhance the user's Dexterity. A common infusion, known as "Shadow Elixir" captures the essence of the plant's stealthy nature, granting heightened agility and reflexes.

item.name: Aetherealis Stellaris
entries: {@b Common Name:} Starflower

{@b Description:} Aetherealis Stellaris is a small plant that grows up to 0.3 meters in height. It has thin, wiry stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are a pale, silvery green. The plant produces clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers that sparkle with a faint, silvery glow. The flowers are a bright white with a hint of silver and emit a soft, sweet fragrance.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Aetherealis Stellaris thrives in high-altitude meadows and rocky outcrops. It prefers welldrained, sandy soils and full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring, ensuring they receive plenty of sunlight. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to dry conditions.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the flowers and leaves of Aetherealis Stellaris in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the flowers quickly to preserve their glow. The leaves can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Aetherealis Stellaris can be used in protective rituals to shield from external threats. This same protective effect can contribute to resistance to a multitude of damage types.

{@b Other Effects:} The berries of Aetherealis Stellaris enhance the user's Charisma. Commonly used in a liqueur known as "Star's Embrace", this effect captures the plant's celestial allure, granting a heightened presence and influence.

item.name: Glacia Veridis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Iceleaf

{@b Description:} Glacia Veridis is a small, hardy plant that grows up to 0.3 meters in height. It has thick, waxy leaves that are a frosty green, covered in tiny ice crystals even in warmer weather. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are white with a faint blue tinge, resembling snowflakes. The flowers emit a crisp, refreshing scent.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Glacia Veridis thrives in cold, mountainous regions and tundras. It prefers well-drained, rocky soils and full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn before the ground freezes. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to low moisture environments.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Glacia Veridis in early winter when they are most potent. Dry the leaves quickly to retain their icy properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Glacia Veridis can imbue the user with an aura of frost. This can help resist cold, but also create a protective aura that both protects the user and affects the surroundings.

{@b Other Effects:} One of the primary side effects of consuming the leaves or root infusion made from Glacia Veridis is the risk of frostbite. The plant's intense cold can affect the user's extremities, causing numbness and a loss of dexterity.

item.name: Serpentis Viridis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Snake Vine

{@b Description:} Serpentis Viridis is a long, winding vine that can grow up to 5 meters in length. It has thick, glossy leaves that are a deep emerald green with a snake-like pattern. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are a dark purple, almost black, with a subtle, musky fragrance. The entire plant is covered in tiny, sharp thorns that secrete a potent toxin.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Serpentis Viridis thrives in warm, humid jungles and swamps with rich, loamy soil. It prefers partial shade and moderate watering. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring and ensure they receive dappled sunlight. Water regularly to maintain soil moisture, but avoid waterlogging.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Serpentis Viridis with extreme caution in late summer. The leaves can be dried and used in various preparations. The flowers, despite their toxic nature, can be processed into powerful medicines under the guidance of a skilled herbalist. Use gloves and avoid direct contact with the plant to prevent poisoning.

{@b Magical Properties:} Using an infusion made from the leaves of Serpentis Viridis, one can create a potent venom. The vine can also be utilized in conjuration magic, typically to conjure snakes or other serpents.
{@b Other Effects:} The most dangerous side effect of using Serpentis Viridis is poison. The potent toxins within the plant can seep into the character's body.

item.name: Lunaris Spectralis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Ghost Lily

{@b Description:} Lunaris Spectralis is a tall, elegant plant that grows up to 0.8 meters in height. It has long, slender leaves that are pale silver, almost translucent. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers that glow with a soft, ethereal light. The flowers are a ghostly white with a hint of blue, and they emit a faint, sweet fragrance that is most noticeable at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Lunaris Spectralis thrives in cool, shaded woodland areas with rich, well-drained soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring, and ensure they receive dappled sunlight.
{@b Preparation:} Harvest the flowers and leaves of Lunaris Spectralis at midnight during the full moon. Dry the flowers slowly to preserve their luminescence. The leaves can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Lunaris Spectralis are most commonly used in effects that deal with undead. By itself, it can contribute to effects that commune or interact with the dead. In tandem with more potent ingredients, Lunaris Spectralis can be used in reviving the fallen.
{@b Other Effects:} Frequent use of Lunaris Spectralis can lead to a condition known as Spirit's Toll, where the user's life force is drained by repeated contact with the plant's mystical energies.

item.name: Tenebris Rosa
entries: {@b Common Name:} Nightshade Rose

{@b Description:} Tenebris Rosa is a small, thorny shrub that grows up to 0.6 meters in height. It has dark purple, almost black leaves with a glossy finish. The plant produces large, black roses with petals that have a deep, velvety texture. The flowers emit a strong, musky fragrance that intensifies at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Tenebris Rosa thrives in dark, shaded areas with rich, loamy soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn in a shaded location. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Tenebris Rosa at midnight during a new moon. Dry the leaves in a dark, cool place to preserve their color and potency. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The petals of Tenebris Rosa are most commonly used in conjuration rituals to summon spectral allies. The same characteristics can contribute to concealment effects such as darkness.
{@b Other Effects:} Repeated use of Tenebris Rosa can lead to a condition known as Haunted Dreams, where the character is plagued by terrifying nightmares and restless sleep.

item.name: Lunae Lilium
entries: {@b Common Name:} Moon Lily

{@b Description:} Lunae Lilium is a low-growing plant, reaching up to 0.15 meters in height. It has long, slender blue leaves with a slight luminescence. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are dark blue with a hint of white.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Lunae Lilium thrives in cool, shaded woodland areas with rich, well-drained soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring or late autumn. Water consistently to keep the soil moist, but avoid waterlogging.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the flowers and leaves of Lunae Lilium at night during a full moon. Dry the flowers slowly to preserve their luminescence. The leaves can be used fresh or dried. For medicinal purposes, create tinctures or infusions with the dried flowers and leaves.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Lunae Lilium have potent mobility effects. Minor uses of this effect can assist mobility and dexterity, while it can be used in more powerful concoctions for teleportation.
{@b Other Effects:} The plant's flowers can also enhance the user's senses, contributing to heightened perception.

item.name: Aetheria Flos
entries: {@b Common Name:} Sky Petal

{@b Description:} Aetheria Flos is a medium-sized plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has sky-blue leaves that appear almost translucent. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, with a faint red luminescence. The flowers emit a soft, ethereal glow during twilight.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Aetheria Flos thrives in high-altitude meadows and rocky outcrops with well-drained, sandy soils. It prefers full sunlight and cooler temperatures. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring and ensure they receive plenty of sunlight. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to dry conditions.
{@b Preparation:} Harvest the flowers and leaves of Aetheria Flos in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the flowers quickly to preserve their glow. The leaves can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The petals of Aetheria Flos are connected to "Celestial Knowledge". This can be extracted to allow the user to access deep and mysterious knowledge that would normally be beyond their reach.

{@b Other Effects:} The primary side effect of using Aetheria Flos is Overload. The influx of vast celestial knowledge can overwhelm the mind, causing temporary cognitive impairment and sensory overload.

item.name: Lacrimae Arboris
entries: {@b Common Name:} Tree of Tears

{@b Description:} Lacrimae Arboris is a small, weeping tree that grows up to 2 meters in height. It has long, drooping branches with thin, dark green leaves that shimmer with a slight iridescence. The plant produces small, pale blue flowers that cluster along the branches, resembling teardrops. The entire tree exudes a faint, musky scent that is most noticeable at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Lacrimae Arboris thrives in dark, damp environments with rich, loamy soil. It prefers partial to full shade and high humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early autumn in a shaded, moist area. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Lacrimae Arboris at dusk during a full moon. Dry the leaves in a dark, cool place to preserve their color and potency. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} Lacrimae Arboris, known for its sorrowful and powerful influence, offers profound magical properties that are highly valued by those who seek to control the battlefield through emotional manipulation. It is best utilized in effects that manipulate or control targets.

{@b Other Effects:} The primary side effect of using Lacrimae Arboris is Emotional Overload. The intense sorrow and grief projected by the plant can backfire, overwhelming the character with the same emotions intended for their enemies.

item.name: Dark Umbra
entries: {@b Common Name:} Shadowbane

{@b Description:} Dark Umbra is a small, sturdy plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has thick, dark green leaves with a slight sheen. The plant produces small, gray, corymb-like flowers (flat and slightly convex clusters) that glow faintly in the dark. The flowers emit a strong, musky fragrance that intensifies at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Dark Umbra thrives in dark, damp environments with rich, loamy soil. It prefers partial to full shade and high humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early autumn in a shaded, moist area. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Dark Umbra at night during a full moon. Dry the leaves in a dark, cool place to preserve their color and potency. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Dark Umbra are used in effects related to sight. Minor concoctions can allow the user to see invisibility, while more potent effects include truesight and scrying.

{@b Other Effects:} The leaves of Dark Umbra provide a boost to Perception, enhancing one's ability to recognize hidden creatures in the shadows. Repeated use of Dark Umbra, however, can lead to a condition known as Nightmares, where the character is plagued by disturbing dreams related to shadows and unseen threats.

item.name: Nivalis Crista
entries: {@b Common Name:} Snow Crest

{@b Description:} Nivalis Crista is a small, hardy plant that grows up to 0.4 meters in height. It has thick, waxy leaves that are black-green and covered in tiny ice crystals. The plant produces small, white flowers that resemble snowflakes and emit a crisp, refreshing scent.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Nivalis Crista thrives in cold, mountainous regions and tundras. It prefers well-drained, rocky soils and full sunlight. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn before the ground freezes. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to low moisture environments.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Nivalis Crista in early winter when they are most potent. Dry the leaves quickly to retain their icy properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried. For medicinal purposes, create infusions or ointments with the dried flowers.

{@b Magical Properties:} Nivalis Crista is most commonly used for its flowers in damaging cold effects. These effects range from blasts of cold to creating blizzards, depending on the potency of the effect.

{@b Other Effects:} The leaves of Nivalis Crista provide a boost to Survival skills, particularly in cold environments. The primary side effect of Nivalis Crista, however, is Frostbite. The intense cold emanating from the plant can cause severe damage to the user's extremities if not handled carefully.

item.name: Aetheris Florealis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Sky Blossom

{@b Description:} Aetheris Florealis is a medium-sized plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has delicate, sky-blue leaves that appear almost translucent. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue and white, with a faint, silver luminescence. The flowers emit a soft, ethereal glow during twilight, making them look like fragments of the night sky.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Aetheris Florealis thrives in high-altitude meadows and rocky outcrops with well-drained, sandy soils. It prefers full sunlight and cooler temperatures. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring and ensure they receive plenty of sunlight. Water sparingly, as the plant is adapted to dry conditions.
{@b Preparation:} Harvest the flowers and leaves of Aetheris Florealis in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the flowers quickly to preserve their glow. The leaves can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Aetheris Florealis are used for effects involving transportation. This sometimes comes in the form of teleportation, but is more commonly used to increase mobility for long periods of time.
{@b Other Effects:} While its flowers contribute to increased mobility, the roots of Aetheris Florealis produce the opposite effect, slowing or disabling those who consume it.

item.name: Lumen Glacialis
entries: {@b Common Name:} Frost Grave

{@b Description:} Lumen Glacialis is a small, delicate plant that grows up to 0.3 meters in height. It has thin, purple leaves that sparkle like ice crystals. The plant produces small, turquoise flowers that emit a faint, cold light. The flowers have a crisp, clean fragrance reminiscent of fresh snow.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Lumen Glacialis thrives in cold, alpine environments with well-drained, rocky soils. It prefers partial to full shade. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early autumn in a cold frame or directly in the ground. Water moderately and protect from strong winds.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Lumen Glacialis in early winter when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves slowly to preserve their icy properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.
{@b Magical Properties:} The leaves and flowers of Lumen Glacialis can be crushed to create a fine powder, which can be used for freezing effects.
{@b Other Effects:} Lumen Glacialis can be used to treat infections or wounds inflicted by poison. Its unique properties make it effective in neutralizing toxins and reducing inflammation.

item.name: Noctis Veneficium
entries: {@b Common Name:} Nightshade Sorcery

{@b Description:} Noctis Veneficium is a small, shadowy plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has dark green, almost black leaves with a glossy finish. The plant produces small, deep purple flowers that emit a faint, magical glow. The flowers have a strong, fragrance that intensifies at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Noctis Veneficium thrives in dark, shaded areas with rich, loamy soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn in a shaded location. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Noctis Veneficium at midnight during a new moon. Dry the leaves in a dark, cool place to preserve their color and potency. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.
{@b Magical Properties:} Noctis Veneficium is most commonly associated with illusion magic. Most potent are its flowers, which can contribute to illusory terrain or traps.
{@b Other Effects:} The illusory effects of Noctis Veneficium can also contribute to stealth, creating effects that conceal the user.

item.name: Astralis Lumina
entries: {@b Common Name:} Star Light

{@b Description:} Astralis Lumina is a small plant that grows up to 0.4 meters in height. It has broad, dark green leaves with a hint of blue, adding a striking contrast to its surroundings. The plant produces fluffy, light yellow flowers that emit a faint, glowing light at night, casting a soft illumination around them. These flowers have a gentle, ethereal fragrance.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Astralis Lumina thrives in cool, well-drained soils in open, starlit areas. It prefers environments with low humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring in an open location. Water sparingly, as the plant is drought-tolerant and does not require much moisture.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Astralis Lumina in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves quickly to preserve their properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} Incorporating the flowers of Astralis Lumina into a magical ritual allows the caster to create an area of celestial protection. Tinctures can also be made from the dried leaves and flowers of Astralis Lumina to channel the plant's celestial energy to heal and rejuvenate.
{@b Other Effects:} Preparing a syrup from the flowers of Astralis Lumina creates an elixir that imbues the consumer with the radiance of starlight, granting increased wisdom.

item.name: Nimbus Alba
entries: {@b Common Name:} White Cloud

{@b Description:} Nimbus Alba is a small, airy plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has delicate, silverwhite leaves that resemble wisps of clouds. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that cluster around the stem, emitting a faint, sweet fragrance. The flowers have a soft, fluffy appearance.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Nimbus Alba thrives in well-drained, sandy soils with partial shade. It prefers environments with moderate humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring in a location with dappled sunlight. Water moderately, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Nimbus Alba in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves quickly to preserve their properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Nimbus Alba are extremely conductive, allowing them to be used towards effects involving lightning damage. This characteristic can also be used in minor resistance effects, but can cause shock to the user's internal organs if prepared incorrectly.
{@b Other Effects:} The potent electricity in Nimbus Alba can be used to pinpoint electrical traps and mechanisms.

item.name: Caelum Flos
entries: {@b Common Name:} Wrath of Heaven

{@b Description:} Caelum Flos is a tall, graceful plant that grows up to 1 meter in height. Its flowers are bright red with fiery orange and golden veins, resembling tongues of flame. The star-shaped petals emit a gentle, warm glow, creating the impression of glowing embers. The leaves of the plant are dark green with blue veins, pointed in shape, and slightly sparkling. The overall appearance of Caelum Flos is striking and captivating, making it a notable sight in any environment.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Caelum Flos thrives in well-drained, sandy soils with full sunlight. It prefers environments with low to moderate humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring in a sunny location. Water sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Caelum Flos in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves quickly to preserve their properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} Preparing an infusion from the roots of Caelum Flos creates a powerful brew that channels the plant's celestial energy into the drinker. This boosts the user's intelligence, but also allows them to better interpret celestial patterns and omens.

{@b Other Effects:} Since the raw flowers enhance perception and the ability to interpret celestial phenomena, this can lead to sensory overload and mental exhaustion. Some people may experience anxiety, hallucinations, or difficulty concentrating.

item.name: Tenebris Gladius
entries: {@b Common Name:} Shadow Blade

{@b Description:} Tenebris Gladius is a medium-sized plant that grows up to 0.6 meters in height. It has long, narrow leaves that are a deep green with a glossy finish. The plant produces dark purple flowers with sharp, pointed petals. The flowers emit a faint, musky fragrance that intensifies at night.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Tenebris Gladius thrives in dark, shaded areas with rich, loamy soil. It prefers environments with high humidity and low light. To cultivate, plant the seeds in late autumn in a shaded location. Water consistently to keep the soil damp but not waterlogged.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves and flowers of Tenebris Gladius in early spring when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves in a dark, well-ventilated place to preserve their properties. The flowers can be used fresh or dried.

{@b Magical Properties:} The flowers of Tenebris Gladius allow the user to enhance a weapon with shadow magic. Depending on the concoction, this can grant the ability to strike with pinpoint accuracy, or deal increased damage.

{@b Other Effects:} Tenebris Gladius contains mild toxins in its leaves and flowers, which can cause dizziness and nausea if ingested in large quantities. It is advised to handle the plant with care and avoid consuming large amounts.

item.name: Aqua Radix
entries: {@b Common Name:} Water Root

{@b Description:} Aqua Radix is a small, sturdy plant that grows up to 0.5 meters in height. It has thick, deep green leaves with a blueish sheen, resembling seaweed. The plant produces small, green berries that contrast with the leaves. The roots are thick and twisted.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Aqua Radix thrives in moist, sandy soils near bodies of water. It prefers environments with high humidity. To cultivate, plant the seeds in early spring near a water source, such as a pond or stream. Water regularly, as the plant requires consistent moisture to thrive.

{@b Preparation:} Harvest the leaves, flowers, and roots of Aqua Radix in mid-summer when they are most vibrant. Dry the leaves and flowers quickly to preserve their properties. The roots can be used fresh or dried.
{@b Magical Properties:} The leaves of Aqua Radix enhances one's swimming ability and understanding of aquatic environments. They are also known to produce the ability to breathe underwater.
{@b Other Effects:} A tincture made from the dried roots of Aqua Radix can alleviate dehydration and restore fluid balance in the body.

item.name: Blood Lotus
entries: {@b Description:} The Blood Lotus is a legendary and visually striking plant that can grow up to 0.7 meters in height. Its broad, dark green leaves provide a stark contrast to its dark crimson petals, which appear as though soaked in blood. The petals have a velvety texture and exude a faint metallic scent reminiscent of iron. The lotus blooms only at night, emitting an eerie red glow that pulses like a heartbeat.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} The Blood Lotus thrives in areas where significant bloodshed has occurred, such as ancient battlefields or sites of massacres. It prefers welldrained, loamy soil rich in organic matter. Cultivating the Blood Lotus is an arduous task due to its unique habitat requirements. To successfully grow this plant, one must replicate its natural environment by using soil from a place of great bloodshed. The plant requires moderate watering and flourishes best under the light of the moon.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting the Blood Lotus requires precision and caution. The petals should be collected at night during a full moon to maximize their potency. Once harvested, the petals must be dried in a cool, dark place to preserve their magical properties. For alchemical purposes, the petals can be ground into a fine powder or steeped in a solution to extract their essence. Creating a Potion of Resurrection from the Blood Lotus requires advanced alchemical skills and several other rare ingredients to stabilize its potent magic.

{@b Magical Properties:} The petals can be brewed into a Potion of Resurrection, capable of reviving a deceased character with full health. Additionally, an infusion of the petals can promote rapid healing and recovery from severe injuries, although such potions are exceedingly rare and complex to prepare.

{@b Other Effects:} The plant's necrotic energy can also cause a debilitating drain on the consumer's life force, leading to exhaustion and weakness. Handling and using the Blood Lotus should be done with extreme caution.

item.name: Star Ivy
entries: {@b Description:} Star Ivy is a legendary and enchanting plant that can grow up to 1 meter in length as it sprawls across the ground or climbs structures. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glow with a soft blue light during the night, creating a mesmerizing display. The glow is faint but steady, illuminating the plant and its surroundings with a gentle, otherworldly luminescence. This distinctive feature makes Star Ivy easily recognizable, even in complete darkness.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Star Ivy thrives exclusively in places where meteorites have impacted the earth. It prefers rocky, well-drained soils enriched with minerals from the meteorites. To successfully grow this plant, one must obtain soil from a meteorite impact site. Star Ivy requires moderate watering and partial sunlight, flourishing under the natural night sky where it can absorb starlight.

{@b Preparation:} The leaves of Star Ivy should be harvested at night when their luminescence is at its peak. Once collected, the leaves must be dried in a dark, cool environment to maintain their magical properties. Ensuring the leaves are handled gently is crucial to preserving their potent cosmic energy.

{@b Magical Properties:} Star Ivy is prized for its exceptional magical properties, having strong connections with space. Wearing a leaf as a talisman, known as the "Meteoric Amulet", grants the bearer resistance to force damage, offering protection against magical attacks. The plant can also be used to bestow the ability to fly. A tincture made from Star Ivy can also grant the ability to see through illusions and hidden magical barriers, a property referred to as Cosmic Vision.

{@b Other Effects:} Star Ivy has potent medicinal uses, particularly in enhancing mental clarity and perception. An infusion of its leaves can clear the mind, helping to dispel confusion and sharpen the senses. This property is highly valued by those who need to detect illusions or perceive hidden magical barriers.

item.name: Thunder Oak Core
entries: {@b Description:} The Thunder Oak Core is an enormous seed, roughly the size of a human head, encased in a shell that crackles with electric energy. The surface of the core is smooth, with intricate patterns resembling lightning bolts etched into it. The core constantly emits small electrical discharges, creating an aura of crackling energy around it. When held, one can feel a tingling sensation as the static electricity courses through their fingers. The core's weight is substantial, and it feels almost alive with the power it contains.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} The Thunder Oak, from which the cores fall, can only be found in areas prone to frequent thunderstorms. These trees thrive in high-altitude regions and open plains where lightning strikes are common. Cultivating a Thunder Oak is nearly impossible due to its unique environmental needs.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting a Thunder Oak Core is a dangerous task, as the tree and its surroundings are often electrified. Once harvested, the core must be handled with care to prevent accidental electrical discharges. The core can be split open to extract a viscous, electrically charged liquid. This liquid can be used in various alchemical preparations or consumed directly for its healing properties. Properly storing the core and its liquid requires containers that can withstand the intense electrical energy.

{@b Magical Properties:} The Thunder Oak Core contains a large amount of raw power, which can contribute to powerful destructive effects. By itself, it can unleash a powerful burst of lightning. With the right ingredients though, it can allow the user to manipulate weather patterns and unleash the full fury of a storm at will.

{@b Other Effects:} The Thunder Oak Core possesses remarkable medicinal properties. The liquid extracted from the core can heal severe wounds and restore vitality. Additionally, the liquid can be used topically to stimulate rapid tissue regeneration.

item.name: Golden Ginseng
entries: {@b Description:} Golden Ginseng is a strikingly beautiful plant, distinguished by its radiant golden roots and leaves that emit a gentle glow in the dark. The plant typically reaches about 30 centimeters in height. Its leaves are broad, with intricate veins that shimmer with a golden hue, and its roots are thick, gnarled.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Golden Ginseng is exceedingly difficult to find and even harder to cultivate. It thrives in remote, undisturbed forest glades and mystical groves, often in the company of other rare flora. The soil must be rich in minerals and blessed with natural magic, usually found in places with a long history of tranquility and spiritual significance. To cultivate Golden Ginseng, one must replicate these unique conditions, providing shaded, nutrient-rich soil and ensuring minimal disturbance. The plant requires consistent, gentle watering and is highly sensitive to environmental changes.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting Golden Ginseng is a delicate process that must be performed with great care to preserve its potent properties. The roots should be carefully dug up and immediately placed in a dark, cool environment to prevent the loss of their magical essence. For alchemical use, the roots are often dried. Ensuring the integrity of the roots during preparation is crucial, as even slight damage can diminish their potency.

{@b Magical Properties:} The most potent use of Golden Ginseng is believed to be temporary immortality, rendering the user invulnerable to all damage and effects. Additionally, the root is able to provide the user with incredible defense against spells and other magical effects, especially those that target the mind. This makes the Golden Ginseng an invaluable asset for adventurers facing formidable magical threats.

{@b Other Effects:} Golden Ginseng is renowned for its unparalleled medicinal properties. When processed into a fine powder, it can restore health and cure all negative conditions, effectively providing instant and complete healing. The root's potent essence makes it a highly sought-after remedy for all manner of ailments, from the mundane to the magical.

item.name: Desert Agave
entries: {@b Description:} The Desert Agave is a robust plant with thick, fleshy leaves that store precious water, allowing it to thrive in the driest deserts. The leaves are a pale green with a waxy surface to minimize water loss. The plant produces radiant flowers that look like small suns, emitting a gentle warmth even in the cold desert nights. These flowers stand out against the harsh, barren landscape, creating a striking visual of life amidst desolation. The Desert Agave can grow up to 1.2 meters in height, with leaves spreading wide to capture any rare moisture from the desert air.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Desert Agave thrives in extremely arid environments, typically found in the heart of vast deserts where few other plants can survive. It prefers sandy, well-drained soil and full sunlight.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting the Desert Agave involves collecting its thick leaves and radiant flowers. The leaves should be carefully cut and dried in the sun. The flowers, which emit warmth, should be handled with care to avoid burning. For alchemical purposes, the leaves can be ground into a powder or used to create a potent tincture.

{@b Magical Properties:} The Desert Agave possesses extraordinary magical properties, as the petals can be used to create a powerful Sandstorm. Additionally, wearing a leaf of Desert Agave, known as the Sand Shield, grants increased resistance to fire and sandstorms, as well as increased survivability in desert environments, making it an indispensable asset for adventurers in arid climates.

{@b Other Effects:} The Desert Agave is known for its remarkable medicinal properties, particularly in providing protection against extreme heat and dehydration. An infusion made from its leaves can bolster the body's natural defenses against fire and sandstorms, granting resistance to these elements. Improper preparation of this rare ingredient, however, can lead to severe dehydration and heatstroke. It is advised to use the Desert Agave under the guidance of a knowledgeable herbalist or alchemist.

item.name: Legendary Oceanic Kelp
entries: {@b Description:} Legendary Oceanic Kelp is a vibrant, underwater plant that grows in shallow coastal waters, often seen along the shoreline during low tide. The plant can reach lengths of up to 2 meters and has long, ribbon-like leaves that glow with a soft, blue luminescence, reminiscent of the ocean's depths. This glow is particularly striking at night, casting a serene, ethereal light that reflects off the water's surface. The leaves are smooth to the touch and sway gently with the ocean's currents, creating a mesmerizing dance under the waves.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Legendary Oceanic Kelp thrives in the nutrientrich waters of ocean shorelines and sea beds. It prefers areas with a mix of sunlight and shade, often growing amidst rocks and coral formations.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting Legendary Oceanic Kelp involves carefully cutting the glowing leaves from the plant while it is submerged to preserve their magical properties. The leaves should be dried slowly in a cool, dark place to maintain their luminescence. For alchemical purposes, the leaves can be ground into a fine powder or used fresh to brew powerful potions and salves. Proper handling is crucial, as the plant's potency is linked to its exposure to seawater and moonlight.

{@b Magical Properties:} Legendary Oceanic Kelp possesses extraordinary magical properties. When processed correctly, its leaves can grant the user with incredible ocean properties. These can range from waterbreathing, to communicating with aquatic animals, to taking a liquid form. This makes Legendary Oceanic Kelp an essential tool for those who venture into aquatic realms or face challenges involving water and ice magic.
{@b Other Effects:} The medicinal properties of Legendary Oceanic Kelp are highly prized, particularly its ability to heal and detoxify.

item.name: Golden Mandrake
entries: {@b Description:} The Golden Mandrake is a legendary and mystical plant, characterized by its human-shaped roots and radiant, golden flowers. The roots, which resemble miniature human figures, have intricate details that give them an almost lifelike appearance. The flowers are bright gold and shimmer under sunlight, emitting a soft glow that enhances their mystical allure. The plant itself grows to about 0.5 meters in height, with broad leaves that provide a lush canopy over its distinctive roots.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} The Golden Mandrake thrives in secluded, enchanted groves, often found in regions rich with magical energy. It prefers fertile, welldrained soil with ample sunlight. Cultivating the Golden Mandrake is notoriously difficult due to its specific environmental needs and the dangers associated with its harvest. To grow this plant, one must ensure a location imbued with natural magic, free from disturbance. The plant requires regular watering and protection from extreme weather conditions to flourish.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting the Golden Mandrake requires great caution due to the plant's potent properties - its terrifying and destructive scream. The roots should be carefully extracted at dawn, when their power is at its lowest. Once harvested, the roots must be immediately stored in a sound-proof container to prevent any accidental activation of their scream. The roots can be dried and ground into a powder or used fresh to brew powerful potions and elixirs.

{@b Magical Properties:} The Golden Mandrake possesses extraordinary magical properties. The roots can emit a Mandrake Scream, a terrifying sound that can cripple most men. A piece of the root can also provide greatly increased health regeneration, as well as max health. These properties make the Golden Mandrake a prized possession for adventurers and healers alike, offering both protection and immense restorative power

{@b Other Effects:} The Golden Mandrake is renowned for its unparalleled medicinal properties. A tincture made from its roots, known as the Elixir of Life, can cure all curses and magical ailments. This powerful remedy is highly sought after for its ability to cleanse the body and spirit of any magical corruption. Additionally, the root's essence can be used in various healing potions to enhance their efficacy, providing robust health benefits and accelerated recovery.

item.name: Fire Lotus
entries: {@b Description:} The Fire Lotus is a striking and extraordinary plant that thrives in the intense heat of volcanic craters. It has vibrant, fiery red and orange petals that seem to flicker like flames, though they are cool to the touch. Despite their appearance, the petals never burn, making the plant a marvel of natural magic. The lotus itself grows to about 0.2 meters in height, with broad, dark green leaves that contrast sharply with the fiery brilliance of its blooms.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} The Fire Lotus exclusively grows in the hostile environment of volcanic craters, thriving in extreme heat and nutrient-rich volcanic soil. Cultivating this plant is nearly impossible outside its natural habitat, as it requires constant exposure to high temperatures and molten lava.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting the Fire Lotus requires great care and protection against the surrounding heat. The petals should be collected during a lull in volcanic activity, when the heat is less intense. Once harvested, the petals must be handled carefully to preserve their magical essence. They can be dried and ground into a fine powder or used fresh to create powerful potions and magical items. Proper storage involves keeping the petals in a dry place to maintain their potency.

{@b Magical Properties:} The Fire Lotus is renowned for its extraordinary magical properties. The petals can be used to create a powerful magical barrier that both absorbs fire damage and reflects it back at the attacker. This shield is a powerful defense against fire-based attacks, providing both protection and counterattack capabilities.
{@b Other Effects:} The petals of the Fire Lotus can give its user the ability to breathe fire in powerful bursts, which rival even the most powerful spells.

item.name: Golden Everfrost
entries: {@b Description:} Golden Everfrost is a mesmerizing plant that grows in the most ancient magical forests. It features golden leaves that emit a golden glow, providing a mystical light in the dark forest undergrowth. The plant also produces silvery flowers, adding to its enchanting appearance. Golden Everfrost typically grows to about 0.6 meters in height, with a sprawling growth habit that allows it to cover the forest floor in a radiant blanket of light.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} Golden Everfrost thrives in ancient, magical forests where the air is thick with enchantment and the soil is rich with arcane energy. It prefers shaded areas with well-drained, fertile soil. Cultivating Golden Everfrost is exceptionally challenging, as it requires recreating the mystical conditions of its natural habitat.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting Golden Everfrost involves careful handling to preserve its potent magical properties. The leaves should be collected at dawn when their glow is most stable. Once harvested, the leaves must be dried in a cool, dark place to maintain their magical essence.

{@b Magical Properties:} Golden Everfrost possesses extraordinary magical properties. The leaves can be used to create a magical barrier that grants incredible defense against spells and magic, as well as the ability to emit bright light. This shield is a powerful defense against dark magic and provides illumination in the darkest of places.

{@b Other Effects:} The medicinal properties of Golden Everfrost are highly prized. A tincture made from its leaves, known as the Elixir of Eternal Life, can cure all diseases and neutralize all poisons.

item.name: Legendary Sand Cactus
entries: {@b Description:} The Legendary Sand Cactus is a formidable plant that thrives in the harshest deserts. It features thick, green flesh covered in striking golden spines that glisten under the desert sun. Atop its body, the cactus produces delicate, silvery flowers that shimmer in the heat. These flowers emit a faint, sweet fragrance that contrasts sharply with the plant's rugged appearance. The Legendary Sand Cactus can grow up to 0.5 meters tall, with a robust and hardy structure that allows it to store water and survive in the most arid conditions.

{@b Habitat & Cultivation:} The Legendary Sand Cactus thrives in extreme desert environments, often found in the most arid and remote areas. It prefers sandy, welldrained soil and requires intense sunlight to flourish. Cultivating the Legendary Sand Cactus is a challenging endeavor, as it demands conditions that mimic its natural habitat.

{@b Preparation:} Harvesting the Legendary Sand Cactus requires caution due to its sharp spines. The flowers and spines should be carefully collected during the early morning when the plant is at its most hydrated. Once harvested, the spines and flowers must be dried in a cool, shaded area to preserve their magical properties. For alchemical purposes, the spines can be ground into a fine powder, and the flowers can be used fresh or dried to create powerful spells. Proper handling is essential to avoid injury and ensure the potency of the plant's magical essence.

{@b Magical Properties:} The Sand Cactus is renowned for its extraordinary magical properties. The flowers of the plant can summon a powerful Sandstorm. This ability, known as Sandstorm Summoning, is a potent weapon in the arsenal of those who can harness its power. Additionally, the spines of the Sand Cactus can be used to create protective wards against desert spirits and other magical threats, providing a versatile tool for desert dwellers and adventurers.

{@b Other Effects:} The Sand Cactus has several medicinal properties, particularly in providing hydration and energy in extreme conditions. An infusion made from its inner flesh can help restore stamina and prevent dehydration, making it a valuable resource for those traveling through the desert.
